column1: Even more tragically for the vicar is the fact that for many unchurched families he is simply a cog – in the death machine ; an impersonal professional who has to mumble a few words before the curtains swish and the coffin descends to the fires below.

column1: Individuals may be seen as ‘ cogs in the machine’ and one of the major criticisms of Taylor's approach was that he had a tendency to treat workers as automatons who would respond to financial incentives automatically.
